alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 6:27PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Indian River County through 700 PM EDT... At 627 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gifford, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Sebastian, Vero Beach, Indian River Shores, Vero Beach South, and Gifford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These types of funnel clouds are harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
